Table of Contents

## Featured Post

### [Should I use an accessibility overlay?](/posts/should-i-use-an-accessibility-overlay/)

March 8, 2021 by The A11Y Project Team

There are two types of accessibility overlays: Temporary bandage solutions, and permanent plugins. The use of a permanent plugin is incredibly problematic.

## Experiences

Lived experiences shared by disabled people.

[### The power of ChatGPT as a cognitive accessibility assistive technology for Traumatic Brain Injury survivors](/posts/the-power-of-chatgpt-as-a-cognitive-accessibility-assistive-technology-for-traumatic-brain-injury-survivors/)

Published on March 14, 2023 by [Jamie Vanderwall](/authors/#jamie-vanderwall)

This essay explores the use of ChatGPT as a cognitive accessibility assistive technology for traumatic brain injury (TBI) survivors.

[### Blind people need to be considered more when making data visualizations](/posts/blind-people-need-to-be-considered-more-when-making-data-visualizations/)

Published on September 22, 2022 by [Johny Cassidy](/authors/#johny-cassidy)

As a blind journalist, I’m concerned that the increased use of visual data representation without careful and creative thought about accessibility is widening the inaccessibility gap.

[### Disability: let’s say the word](/posts/lets-say-the-word-disability/)

Published on October 18, 2021 by [Emily Ogle](/authors/#emily-ogle)

In hesitating to use the word ‘disability,’ people are unwittingly reinforcing the stigma that having a disability is a bad thing.

[### How I deal with colorblindness as a digital product designer](/posts/how-i-deal-with-colorblindness-as-a-digital-product-designer/)

Published on October 9, 2021 by [Federico Monaco](/authors/#federico-monaco)

What it means to be a colorblind designer and what the main problems are that someone with colorblindness can encounter if they decide to pursue a career as a designer.

## Background

General information for help in thinking about different parts of digital accessibility.

[### What is Semantic HTML?](/posts/what-is-semantic-html/)

Published on April 4, 2023 by [David A. Kennedy](/authors/#david-a-kennedy)

The Web Accessibility Initiative is W3C's effort to improve accessibility of the Web for people with disabilities.

[### A guide to troublesome UI components](/posts/a-guide-to-troublesome-ui-components/)

Published on February 14, 2023 by [Martin Lexelius](/authors/#martin-lexelius)

Some UI components that have non-trivial considerations to use in an accessible way.

[### What is WAI? The Web Accessibility Initiative](/posts/what-is-wai/)

Published on July 18, 2022 by [Ilknur Eren](/authors/#ilknur-eren)

The Web Accessibility Initiative is W3C's effort to improve accessibility of the Web for people with disabilities.

[### Should I use an accessibility overlay?](/posts/should-i-use-an-accessibility-overlay/)

Published on March 8, 2021 by [The A11Y Project Team](/authors/#the-a11y-project-team)

There are two types of accessibility overlays: Temporary bandage solutions, and permanent plugins. The use of a permanent plugin is incredibly problematic.

[### Dyslexia fonts](/posts/dyslexia-fonts/)

Published on February 22, 2021 by [Hamsa Harcourt](/authors/#hamsa-harcourt)

A quick overview of dyslexia fonts.

[### Introduction to WCAG 2.x](/posts/wcag2-documents/)

Published on October 14, 2020 by [Hamsa Harcourt](/authors/#hamsa-harcourt)

A quick overview of WCAG 2.x documents.

[### Introduction to the Web Accessibility Initiative](/posts/introduction-to-wai/)

Published on October 2, 2020 by [Hamsa Harcourt](/authors/#hamsa-harcourt)

Key facts about web accessibility initiative, what it is, and why it exists.

[### An in-depth guide to ARIA roles](/posts/an-indepth-guide-to-aria-roles/)

Published on August 20, 2020 by [Duncan Jimbo](/authors/#duncan-jimbo)

ARIA roles are one half of the predefined categories of attributes used to describe elements that may not exist natively in browsers or may not be understood by screen readers and other assistive technologies.

[### ARIA states](/posts/aria-states/)

Published on July 30, 2018 by [Alex Brenon](/authors/#alex-brenon)

A quick introduction to ARIA's states.

[### ARIA properties](/posts/aria-properties/)

Published on July 30, 2018 by [Alex Brenon](/authors/#alex-brenon)

A quick introduction to ARIA's properties.

[### Understanding color blindness](/posts/understanding-colourblindness/)

Published on October 18, 2017 by [Matthew Higgins](/authors/#matthew-higgins)

What is color blindness, and how can we design with it in mind?

[### What is color contrast?](/posts/what-is-color-contrast/)

Published on January 5, 2015 by [Rachel R. Vasquez](/authors/#rachel-r-vasquez)

What is color contrast and why do we need it for web accessibility?

[### Getting started with ARIA](/posts/getting-started-aria/)

Published on May 15, 2014 by [Monika Piotrowicz](/authors/#monika-piotrowicz)

Introduction to ARIA, describing Roles, States, and Properties and when to use ARIA in HTML.

[### A primer to vestibular disorders](/posts/understanding-vestibular-disorders/)

Published on May 5, 2013 by [Dennis Gaebel](/authors/#dennis-gaebel)

Key facts, definitions, demographics and causes of vestibular disorders.

[### A primer to visual impairment](/posts/understanding-visual-impairment/)

Published on January 22, 2013 by [Nat Tarnoff](/authors/#nat-tarnoff)

Key facts, definitions, demographics, causes, challenges and future of visual impairment.

## Myths

Common misconceptions and falsehoods about accessibility.

[### Automated tools can ensure full accessibility compliance](/posts/automated-tools-can-ensure-full-accessibility-compliance/)

Published on March 10, 2025 by [Melwyn Joseph](/authors/#melwyn-joseph)

Can automated tools guarantee full compliance with accessibility standards like WCAG? The short answer is no.

[### Accessibility and SEO](/posts/accessibility-seo/)

Published on July 1, 2021 by [Cooper Hollmaier](/authors/#cooper-hollmaier)

SEO and accessibility have a lot more in common than you would think. Many of the same practices that we use to further enable people to enjoy our digital experiences are also great for search engines.

[### Alternate text and automation](/posts/alternate-text-and-automation/)

Published on March 23, 2021 by [Eric Bailey](/authors/#eric-bailey)

Alternate (alt) text help people who use assistive technology understand images, and are a core part of the Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG). They require a human’s input to be effective.

[### ARIA has perfect support](/posts/aria-has-perfect-support/)

Published on May 13, 2020 by [Eric Bailey](/authors/#eric-bailey)

ARIA is a very useful tool for helping to enhance accessible web experiences, but it should only be used when no other options are available.

[### People who use screen readers don't use JavaScript](/posts/people-who-use-screen-readers-dont-use-javascript/)

Published on April 21, 2013 by [Dave Rupert](/authors/#dave-rupert)

97.6% of all screen readers have JavaScript enabled.

[### Accessibility is 'blind people'](/posts/accessibility-is-blind-people/)

Published on January 11, 2013 by [Dave Rupert](/authors/#dave-rupert)

A brief explanation of the four categories of accessibility.

## Quick tests

Things you can quickly try out to check for inaccessible experiences.

[### Resize text](/posts/resize-text/)

Published on November 26, 2018 by [Luis Garcia](/authors/#luis-garcia)

How to test the Resize Text WCAG Success Criterion.

[### Large touch targets](/posts/large-touch-targets/)

Published on November 21, 2018 by [Eric Bailey](/authors/#eric-bailey)

How to determine if your touch targets are large enough to be used.

[### Check comprehension level](/posts/check-comprehension-level/)

Published on January 25, 2013 by [Nat Tarnoff](/authors/#nat-tarnoff)

you can check the reading level of your written content by using these tools.

[### Check contrast with your mobile device](/posts/check-contrast-with-mobile-device/)

Published on January 22, 2013 by [Dave Rupert](/authors/#dave-rupert)

Using an ordinary mobile device you can check your site's readability.

[### Navigate using just your keyboard](/posts/navigate-using-just-your-keyboard/)

Published on January 11, 2013 by [Dave Rupert](/authors/#dave-rupert)

A quick accessibility test that you can run on your sites right now.

## Quick tips

Short, easy-to-digest and easy-to-implement accessibility-related information.

[### Starting a design with accessibility](/posts/starting-a-design-with-accessibility/)

Published on August 25, 2021 by [Steve Barnett](/authors/#steve-barnett)

Three quick tips to help us design more accessibly.

[### Reviewing a design for accessibility](/posts/reviewing-a-design-for-accessibility/)

Published on August 14, 2021 by [Steve Barnett](/authors/#steve-barnett)

Reviewing designs for accessibility is a great way to help designers think more accessibly and to help developers implement more accessibly. We can use short checklists to help us make sure we haven't missed any big things.

[### Everyday Accessibility](/posts/everyday-accessibility/)

Published on June 15, 2021 by [Michele A. Williams, PhD](/authors/#michele-a-williams-phd)

Make your social media, digital document, and multimedia content more accessible with these quick and practical steps.

[### Creating valid and accessible links](/posts/creating-valid-and-accessible-links/)

Published on February 15, 2019 by [Emma Patricios](/authors/#emma-patricios)

Links are used on almost every site on the web, however it is easy to create links that are not accessible to all.

[### Browser keyboard navigation in macOS](/posts/macos-browser-keyboard-navigation/)

Published on December 29, 2017 by [Scott Vinkle](/authors/#scott-vinkle)

How to enable full keyboard support in browsers on macOS.

[### a11y and a brief numeronyms primer](/posts/a11y-and-other-numeronyms/)

Published on August 26, 2017 by [Scott O'Hara](/authors/#scott-ohara)

The numeronym 'a11y' is shorthand for 'accessibility.'

[### Never remove CSS outlines](/posts/never-remove-css-outlines/)

Published on January 25, 2013 by [Guilherme Simões](/authors/#guilherme-simoes)

Removing CSS outlines without proper fallbacks can make it impossible to navigate your site with a keyboard.

[### Don't auto-play video, music and more](/posts/never-use-auto-play/)

Published on January 15, 2013 by [Emma Patricios](/authors/#emma-patricios)

Why you shouldn't auto-play anything that could distract the user from their main task.

[### Never use `maximum-scale='1.0'`](/posts/never-use-maximum-scale/)

Published on January 14, 2013 by [Thomas Sjögren](/authors/#thomas-sjogren)

Why you never ever should use `maximum-scale='1.0'` in your viewport meta tag.

[### ARIA Landmark roles and HTML5 implicit mapping](/posts/aria-landmark-roles/)

Published on January 14, 2013 by [Erik Runyon](/authors/#erik-runyon)

Use ARIA Landmark Roles to help assistive devices navigate the markup.

[### Using alt text properly](/posts/alt-text/)

Published on January 14, 2013 by [Susan Robertson](/authors/#susan-robertson)

A few tips on how and when to use the alt attribute. Make sure the text is helpful and most importantly meaningful.

[### Create accessible data tables](/posts/accessible-data-tables/)

[### Using captions with HTML's video element](/posts/using-caption-services-with-html5-video/)
